name: slaty
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the colour of slate (= a dark grey rock that can be easily divided into thin pieces): They walked through the slaty darkness beneath the palm trees. He now looked across at her with his slaty dark eyes. The sky was dark, and the sea was a slatier kind of grey, with white horses dancing on the waves. The wolf looked at me with a cold expression in its slatey little eyes.
containing or made of slate: This hill is covered with a reddish slaty stone. In some places the river bed was crossed by slaty reefs. The rocks were slatey and treacherous, breaking away in thick flakes under our feet.
More examplesFewer examplesHe wore a slaty grey coat.Slaty pedestals supported the columns above.The lights of the city shone out against the slaty sky.We set off on our journey under slatey skies.
